com.mapdigit.gis.geometry

Class GeoSize

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapdigit.gis.geometry.GeoSize

  • public class GeoSize
extends java.lang.Object
    The GeoSize class encapsulates the width and height of a component (in integer precision) in a single object.
    © Copyright 2009 Guidebee Pty Ltd.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double height
      The height GeoSize; negative values can be used.
      double width
      The width GeoSize; negative values can be used.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GeoSize()
      Creates an instance of GeoSize with a width of zero and a height of zero.
      GeoSize(double width, double height)
      Constructs a GeoSize and initializes it to the specified width and specified height.
      GeoSize(GeoSize size)
      Creates an instance of GeoSize whose width and height are the same as for the specified GeoSize.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      Checks whether two GeoSize objects have equal values.
      double getHeight()
      get the height.
      GeoSize getSize()
      Gets the size of this GeoSize object.
      double getWidth()
      get the width.
      int hashCode()
      Returns the hash code for this GeoSize.
      void setSize(double width, double height)
      Sets the size of this GeoSize object to the specified width and height in double precision.
      void setSize(GeoSize d)
      Sets the size of this GeoSize object to match the specified size.
      void setSize(int width, int height)
      Sets the size of this GeoSize object to the specified width and height.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the values of this GeoSize object's height and width fields.

      • GeoSize

        public GeoSize()
        Creates an instance of GeoSize with a width of zero and a height of zero.

      • GeoSize

        public GeoSize(GeoSize size)
        Creates an instance of GeoSize whose width and height are the same as for the specified GeoSize.
        Parameters:
        size - the specified GeoSize for the width and height values

      • GeoSize

        public GeoSize(double width,
       double height)
        Constructs a GeoSize and initializes it to the specified width and specified height.
        Parameters:
        width - the specified width
        height - the specified height

    • Method Detail

      • getWidth

        public double getWidth()
        get the width.
        Returns:
        the width of the geo size.

      • setSize

        public void setSize(GeoSize d)
        Sets the size of this GeoSize object to match the specified size. This method is included for completeness, to parallel the getSize method of Component.
        Parameters:
        d - the new size for the GeoSize object

      • getHeight

        public double getHeight()
        get the height.
        Returns:
        the height of the geo size.

      • setSize

        public void setSize(double width,
           double height)
        Sets the size of this GeoSize object to the specified width and height in double precision. Note that if width or height are larger than Integer.MAX_VALUE, they will be reset to Integer.MAX_VALUE.
        Parameters:
        width - the new width for the GeoSize object
        height - the new height for the GeoSize object

      • getSize

        public GeoSize getSize()
        Gets the size of this GeoSize object. This method is included for completeness, to parallel the getSize method defined by Component.
        Returns:
        the size of this GeoSize, a new instance of GeoSize with the same width and height

      • setSize

        public void setSize(int width,
           int height)
        Sets the size of this GeoSize object to the specified width and height. This method is included for completeness, to parallel the setSize method defined by Component.
        Parameters:
        width - the new width for this GeoSize object
        height - the new height for this GeoSize object

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Checks whether two GeoSize objects have equal values.

        ture if they have same size.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the values of this GeoSize object's height and width fields. This method is intended to be used only for debugging purposes, and the content and format of the returned string may vary between implementations. The returned string may be empty but may not be null.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of this GeoSize object
